principles: Favor efficiency for expert users (keyboard, batch actions).
Maintain high information density where appropriate (tables, filters).
Ensure deterministic behavior; avoid unexpected auto-changes.
Respect roles/permissions; labels should reflect access.
Support error prevention and recovery (confirm, undo where safe).
Preserve auditability; changes should be traceable.
Use precise terminology consistent with domain vocabulary.

tables: Sortable, filterable, and paginated with clear affordances.
Bulk selection with clear actions and confirmation for destructive ops.
Keyboard navigation for rows and cells where possible.
forms: Group related fields; show required vs optional.
Provide inline validation and clear error messages.
Allow save without navigating away (stay on page).
filters: Advanced filters available without hiding critical options.
Persist last-used filters per user when possible.
Show applied filters clearly with easy removal.

terminology.notes: Use domain-specific nouns; avoid consumer app slang.
